Hi, I'm Siddhit.

Welcome! I built this website to learn web development and to share the things I like doing. To see my professional work, see my résumé

Build

I help build tech and teams to improve manufacturing with software and data.

Most recently, I've been US Ops Lead at Pashi, the operating system for manufacturing. This being a seed-stage YC startup, I wear multiple hats, helping with product marketing (for example, I produced and hosted its podcast, the Means of Production, in which I spoke to manufacturing experts on their careers and factory floor challenges). Wearing the product management hat I created exhaustive documentation for features, stress tested the platform, built data models, designed key operational metrics, and mocked detailed front-end mockups for new and existing features for the development and UI teams.

I like being at the intersection of manufacturing and software and while at Ford Motor Company, I translated my experience of building vast and complex assembly lines to create data engineering assets to help production managers make better on-floor decisions. I also served part-time as co-owner for an app I ideated, pitched and funded with C-suite executives to digitize launch-related activities on the factory floor.

With the advent of IIoT technologies and code in the manufacturing sector, there is great potential in modernizing manufacturing operations, especially in the US. But when applying such tools and systems, it is important to know this: the truth is on the floor

Create

I write fiction stories and sculpt the main protagonist in ink or clay at Sculpt-a-Story on Substack. See a sample of my writing on this Reedsy blog. I also like to occasionally read, garden, code and dive headlong into rabbit-holes about trivia nobody needs.

I also help my wife build her home-decor & design business, studio dharaesque with copywriting and operational matters, and lifting heavy things.
